00035 SYLPH_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00036 class Any;
00037 template<class T> class Array;
00038 
00039 SYLPH_PUBLIC
00040 
00055 template<class T>
00056 class Array : public virtual Object {
00057 private:
00058     size_t _length;
00059 public:
00060 
00061     class iterator : public RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> {
00062     public:
00063         typedef RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> super;
00064 
00065         iterator(bool begin = false, Array<T>* obj = NULL)
00066         : super(begin), _obj(obj) {
00067             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : (_obj->length - 1);
00068         }
00069 
00070         iterator(bool begin = false, const Array<T>* obj = NULL)
00071         : super(begin), _obj(const_cast<Array<T>*> (obj)) {
00072             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : (_obj->length - 1);
00073         }
00074 
00075         bool equals(const iterator& other) const {
00076             return _currentIndex == other._currentIndex &&
00077                     _obj == other._obj;
00078         }
00079 
00080         iterator(const iterator& other) {
00081             _currentIndex = other._currentIndex;
00082             _obj = other._obj;
00083         }
00084 
00085         typename super::reference current() const {
00086             return (*_obj)[_currentIndex];
00087         }
00088 
00089         bool hasNext() const {
00090             return _currentIndex < (_obj->length - 1);
00091         }
00092 
00093         void next() const {
00094             _currentIndex++;
00095         }
00096 
00097         bool hasPrevious() const {
00098             return _currentIndex >= 0;
00099         }
00100 
00101         void previous() const {
00102             _currentIndex--;
00103         }
00104 
00105         idx_t currentIndex() const {
00106             return _currentIndex;
00107         }
00108 
00109         size_t length() const {
00110             return _obj->length;
00111         }
00112     private:
00113         mutable idx_t _currentIndex;
00114         Array<T>* _obj;
00115     };
00116     S_ITERABLE(T)
00117 public:
00124     typedef bool(*FilterFunction)(const T&, Any&);
00130     const size_t & length;
00131 
00140     inline static Array<T> fromPointer(std::size_t length, T * orig) {
00141         Array<T> ar(length);
00142         for (int x = 0; x < length; x++)ar[x] = orig[x];
00143         return ar;
00144     }
00145 public:
00146 
00153     explicit Array(std::size_t len = 0) : _length(len), length(_length),
00154             data(new Data(len)) {
00155     }
00156 
00167     Array(const std::initializer_list<T> & il) : _length(il.size()), 
00168             length(_length), data(new Data(_length)) {
00169         for (idx_t i = 0; i < il.size(); i++) {
00170             data->_carray[i] = il.begin()[i];
00171         }
00172     }
00173 
00185     template<size_t N>
00186     Array(const T(&array)[N]) : _length(N), length(_length), data(new Data(N)) {
00187         for (idx_t i = 0; i < _length; i++) {
00188             data->_carray[i] = array[i];
00189         }
00190     }
00191 
00200     Array(const Array<T> & other) : _length(other._length), length(_length),
00201         data(other.data){
00202         data->refcount++;
00203     }
00204 
00216     Array(const basic_range<T> & ran) : _length(ran.last() - ran.first()),
00217     length(_length), data(new Data(length)) {
00218         idx_t idx = 0;
00219         for (T x = ran.first(); x < ran.last(); x++) {
00220             *this[idx] = x;
00221             idx++;
00222         }
00223     }
00224 
00235     explicit Array(const T& t) : _length(1), length(_length),
00236             data(new Data(1)) {
00237         data->_carray[0] = t;
00238     }
00239 
00244     virtual ~Array() {
00245         data->refcount--;
00246         if (!data->refcount) {
00247             delete data;
00248             data = NULL;
00249         }
00250     }
00251 
00260     Array<T> copy() const {
00261         Array<T> toReturn((std::size_t)length);
00262         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00263             toReturn[i] = (*this)[i];
00264         }
00265         return toReturn;
00266     }
00267 
00273     T * carray() {
00274         return data->_carray;
00275     }
00276 
00283     const T *carray() const {
00284         return data->_carray;
00285     }
00286 
00295     Array<T> filter(FilterFunction func, Any& clientData) {
00296         // I'm terribly sorry but we'll need to iterate twice over the Array...
00297         size_t newlength;
00298         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00299             if (func(*this[i], clientData)) newlength++;
00300         }
00301         Array<T> toReturn(newlength);
00302         idx_t curpos = 0;
00303         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00304             if (func(*this[i], clientData)) {
00305                 toReturn[curpos] = *this[i];
00306                 curpos++;
00307             }
00308         }
00309         return toReturn;
00310     }
00311 
00316     void clear() {
00317         delete this->data->_carray;
00318         this->data->_carray = new T[this->data->_length];
00319     }
00320 
00329     Array<T> & operator=(const Array<T> & other) {
00330         if (this->data == other.data) return *this;
00331         this->data->refcount--;
00332         if (!this->data->refcount) delete this->data;
00333         this->data = other.data;
00334         this->_length = other.data->_length;
00335         data->refcount++;
00336         return *this;
00337     }
00338 
00347     T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) throw (Exception) {
00348         if ((idx < (sidx_t)length) && (idx >= -(sidx_t)length)) {
00349             return idx >= 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray[length + idx];
00350         } else {
00351             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00352         }
00353     }
00354 
00362     const T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) const throw (Exception) {
00363         if ((idx < (sidx_t)length) && (idx >= -(sidx_t)length)) {
00364             return idx >= 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray[length + idx];
00365         } else {
00366             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00367         }
00368     }
00369 
00378     Array<T> operator[](const range & ran) throw (Exception) {
00379         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() >= length)
00380             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00381 
00382         Array<T> toReturn = Array<T>::fromPointer((ran.last() - ran.first())+1,
00383                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00384         return toReturn;
00385     }
00386 
00392     const Array<T> operator[](const range & ran) const throw (Exception) {
00393         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() >= length)
00394             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00395 
00396         Array<T> toReturn = Array<T>::fromPointer((ran.last() - ran.first())+1,
00397                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00398         return toReturn;
00399     }
00400 
00401 #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00402 protected:
00403 
00404     struct Data {
00405 
00406         explicit Data(size_t length) : _length(length), 
00407                  _carray(new T[length]()), refcount(1) {
00408 
00409         }
00410 
00411         virtual ~Data() {
00412             delete _carray;
00413         }
00414         const size_t _length;
00415         T * _carray;
00416         suint refcount;
00417     } * data;
00418 #endif
00419 };
00420 
00429 template<class T>
00430 inline bool operator==(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00431     if(lhs.length == rhs.length) {
00432         for(idx_t i = 0; i < lhs.length; i++) {
00433             if(lhs[i] != rhs[i]) return false;
00434         }
00435         return true;
00436     }
00437     return false;
00438 }
00439 
00448 template<class T>
00449 inline bool operator<(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00450     return std::lexicographical_compare(&lhs[0], &lhs[lhs.length-1],
00451             &rhs[0], &rhs[rhs.length-1]);
00452 }

00456 #endif  /* ARRAY_H_ */
